name: gaudi

variants.name: optional
variants.description: Build most optional components and tests

variants.name: vtune
variants.description: Build with Intel VTune profiler support

description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: aida
dependencies.description: Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: clhep
dependencies.description: CLHEP is a C++ Class Library for High Energy Physics.

dependencies.name: cppgsl
dependencies.description: C++ Guideline Support Library

dependencies.name: fmt
dependencies.description:
fmt (formerly cppformat) is an open-source formatting library. It can be
used as a safe alternative to printf or as a fast alternative to C++
IOStreams.

dependencies.name: intel-tbb
dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.

dependencies.name: uuid
dependencies.description:
OSSP uuid is a ISO-C:1999 application programming interface (API) and
corresponding command line interface (CLI) for the generation of DCE
1.1, ISO/IEC 11578:1996 and RFC 4122 compliant Universally Unique
Identifier (UUID).

dependencies.name: nlohmann-json
dependencies.description: JSON for Modern C++

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-xenv
dependencies.description: Helpers to work with the environment in a platform independent way.

dependencies.name: range-v3
dependencies.description:
Range v3 forms the basis of a proposal to add range support to the
standard library (N4128: Ranges for the Standard Library). It also will
be the reference implementation for an upcoming Technical Specification.
These are the first steps toward turning ranges into an international
standard.

dependencies.name: root
dependencies.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: py-nose
dependencies.description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: cppunit
dependencies.description: Obsolete Unit testing framework for C++

dependencies.name: doxygen
dependencies.description:
Doxygen is the de facto standard tool for generating documentation from
annotated C++ sources, but it also supports other popular programming
languages such as C, Objective-C, C#, PHP, Java, Python, IDL (Corba,
Microsoft, and UNO/OpenOffice flavors), Fortran, VHDL, Tcl, and to some
extent D..

dependencies.name: gperftools
dependencies.description:
Google's fast malloc/free implementation, especially for multi-threaded
applications. Contains tcmalloc, heap-checker, heap-profiler, and cpu-
profiler.

dependencies.name: gdb
dependencies.description:
GDB, the GNU Project debugger, allows you to see what is going on
'inside' another program while it executes -- or what another program
was doing at the moment it crashed.

dependencies.name: gsl
dependencies.description:
The GNU Scientific Library (GSL) is a numerical library for C and C++
programmers. It is free software under the GNU General Public License.
The library provides a wide range of mathematical routines such as
random number generators, special functions and least-squares fitting.
There are over 1000 functions in total with an extensive test suite.

dependencies.name: heppdt
dependencies.description:
The HepPID library contains translation methods for particle ID's to and
from various Monte Carlo generators and the PDG standard numbering
scheme. We realize that the generators adhere closely to the standard,
but there are occasional differences.

dependencies.name: jemalloc
dependencies.description:
jemalloc is a general purpose malloc(3) implementation that emphasizes
fragmentation avoidance and scalable concurrency support.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: libunwind
dependencies.description:
A portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the
call-chain of a program.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: relax
dependencies.description:
A set of Reflex libraries for the most common used general data types in
the LHC Computing Grid

dependencies.name: xerces-c
dependencies.description:
Xerces-C++ is a validating XML parser written in a portable subset of
C++. Xerces-C++ makes it easy to give your application the ability to
read and write XML data. A shared library is provided for parsing,
generating, manipulating, and validating XML documents using the DOM,
SAX, and SAX2 APIs.

dependencies.name: intel-parallel-studio
dependencies.description: Intel Parallel Studio.
